title: Changing Font Family
ques: How can you change the font of a paragraph to Arial and use a fallback font in case Arial is not available?
explanation:
The ***font-family*** property specifies the typeface to be used.
- The value ***Arial*** is the primary font.
- The ***Helvetica*** font is a backup in case Arial is not available.
- The ***sans-serif*** is a generic fallback ensuring readability.

title: Text Alignment
ques: How do you center-align all paragraphs inside a div?
explanation:
The ***text-align*** property controls horizontal alignment of text.
- The ***center*** value makes all text inside the ***div*** align to the center.

title: Adjusting Line Height
ques: How can you increase the space between lines in a paragraph?
explanation:
The ***line-height*** property defines the space between lines of text.
- A value of ***1.8*** means the line height is ***1.8 times*** the font size, improving readability.

title: Letter Spacing
ques: How can you increase the space between letters of a heading?
explanation:
The ***letter-spacing*** property controls the space between characters.
- A value of ***2px*** increases spacing, making the text more readable or stylish.

title: Using Google Fonts
ques: How can you use the 'Roboto' font from Google Fonts in a webpage?

answer.content: This is a paragraph with the Roboto font.

explanation:
1. We include the Google Fonts link inside the ***<head>*** section using the ***<link>*** tag.
2. The ***font-family*** property in ***CSS*** applies the 'Roboto' font to the ***body***.
3. If 'Roboto' is not available, the ***sans-serif*** fallback will be used.

title: Justifying Text
ques: How can you justify the text inside a paragraph?
explanation:
The ***text-align*** property controls the horizontal alignment of text.
- The ***justify*** value ensures that the text stretches evenly across the width, aligning both the left and right edges.

title: Double Line Height
ques: How can you set the line height of a paragraph to be double its font size?
explanation:
The ***line-height*** property adjusts the spacing between lines of text.
- A value of ***2*** means the spacing is ***twice the font size***, improving readability.

title: Adding Space Between Letters
ques: How can you add more space between letters in a paragraph?
explanation:
The ***letter-spacing*** property increases or decreases the space between characters.
- A value of ***3px*** adds 3 pixels of space between each letter, making the text more spaced out.

title: Using Multiple Fonts
ques: How can you apply different fonts to headings and paragraphs?
explanation:
The ***font-family*** property allows specifying different fonts for different elements.
- ***h1*** uses ***Georgia, serif*** for a classic style.
- ***p*** uses ***Arial, sans-serif*** for a modern and readable look.

title: Centering Text with Flexbox
ques: How can you center text both horizontally and vertically inside a div using Flexbox?
explanation:
Flexbox provides a simple way to center content.
- ***display: flex;*** enables flexbox.
- ***justify-content: center;*** centers the text horizontally.
- ***align-items: center;*** centers the text vertically.

title: Using em for Line Height
ques: How can you set the line height of a paragraph relative to its font size?
explanation:
The ***em*** unit makes the ***line-height*** relative to the font size.
- A value of ***1.5em*** means the spacing is ***1.5 times*** the font size.
- This approach keeps text proportional across different font sizes.

title: Kerning with Letter Spacing
ques: How can you reduce the space between letters for a more compact look?
explanation:
The ***letter-spacing*** property can also reduce space between letters.
- A value of ***-1px*** brings characters closer together.
- This is useful for compact headings or custom typography styles.

title: Using System Fonts
ques: How can you apply the system default font to a paragraph?
explanation:
The ***system-ui*** font ensures that the paragraph text matches the default operating system font.
- ***system-ui*** uses the system's default UI font (e.g., Segoe UI on Windows, San Francisco on macOS).
- The ***sans-serif*** fallback ensures compatibility.

title: Right Align Text
ques: How do you align all text to the right inside a div?
explanation:
The ***text-align*** property is used for horizontal alignment.
- The ***right*** value shifts all text inside the ***div*** to the right.

title: Setting Line Height in Pixels
ques: How can you set the line height of a paragraph to exactly 24px?
explanation:
The ***line-height*** property can take absolute values.
- A value of ***24px*** ensures a fixed line spacing, regardless of font size.

title: Adding Extra Large Letter Spacing
ques: How can you make text in an h1 have extremely wide spacing between letters?
explanation:
The ***letter-spacing*** property controls space between characters.
- A value of ***10px*** creates a dramatic spacing effect.

title: Combining Multiple Fonts
ques: How can you set a paragraph to use 'Times New Roman' but fall back to 'Georgia' or 'serif' if unavailable?
explanation:
The ***font-family*** property allows specifying multiple fonts.
- The ***Times New Roman*** font is used first.
- If unavailable, the ***Georgia*** font is tried.
- The ***serif*** fallback ensures a similar look.

title: Text Alignment in a Table
ques: How can you center-align text inside all table cells?
explanation:
The ***text-align*** property aligns text within elements.
- Applying ***center*** to ***td*** elements makes all table cell text center-aligned.

title: Using Percentage for Line Height
ques: How can you set the line height of a paragraph to 150% of the font size?
explanation:
The ***line-height*** property can be set as a percentage.
- A value of ***150%*** means the line spacing is ***1.5 times*** the font size.

title: Negative Letter Spacing
ques: How can you reduce the letter spacing of an h2 heading for a tighter look?
explanation:
The ***letter-spacing*** property accepts negative values.
- A value of ***-2px*** makes letters appear closer together.

title: Applying Italic Font Style
ques: How can you make all text inside a div italic?
explanation:
The ***font-style*** property changes text appearance.
- ***italic*** makes the text slanted for emphasis.

title: Text Alignment with Justify and Indent
ques: How can you justify a paragraph and also add an indentation to the first line?
explanation:
The ***text-align*** property ensures even spacing across the width.
- ***justify*** makes text spread out evenly.
- ***text-indent: 20px;*** indents the first line for better readability.

title: Using a Web Safe Font Stack
ques: How can you set a web-safe font stack for better compatibility?
explanation:
The ***font-family*** property allows specifying multiple fallback fonts.
- ***Arial*** is the preferred font.
- ***Verdana*** and ***Helvetica*** act as backups.
- ***sans-serif*** ensures a readable default if all others fail.

title: Using rem for Line Height
ques: How can you set the line height of a paragraph to 2 times the root font size?
explanation:
The ***rem*** unit makes ***line-height*** relative to the root font size.
- ***2rem*** means the spacing is ***twice the root font size***.

title: Text Shadow for Styling
ques: How can you apply a subtle text shadow to headings?
explanation:
The ***text-shadow*** property adds a shadow effect to text.
- ***2px 2px 5px gray*** means:
  - ***2px*** horizontal offset.
  - ***2px*** vertical offset.
  - ***5px*** blur radius.
  - ***gray*** shadow color.
